intro: Tanacetum siculum, commonly known as the common tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Tanacetum siculum is known for its strong aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
